intro: Narcissus gadorensis, commonly known as the Gador daffodil, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a white corona. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its bulbs are perennial, and it blooms in early spring, adding vibrant color to the landscape. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
